selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional
Class LinearGaussian

java.lang.Object
  selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.AbstractConditionalDistribution
      selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.LinearGaussian
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConditionalDistribution
public class LinearGaussian
extends AbstractConditionalDistribution

Distribution for continuous variable with only continuous parents, this is linear in the sense that the mean is a linear combination of each parent value. Variance is not dependent upon the values of parents. i.e. P(X) = N(B_0 + B^TX^T, sigma^2). In the case of multivariate parents, each dimension needs another coefficient. Also this distribution itself can be multivariate and as such will need another set of coefficients for each dimension.

Author:
Charles Robertson

Constructor Summary
LinearGaussian()
          Creates a default linear gaussian with no parents, corresponding to a mu of 0 and variance of 1;

          Creates a Linear Gaussian distribution with the specified mean, coefficients, and covariance.

          Upgrades a Gaussian distribution to a Linear Gaussian distribution with no parents

          Creates a default Linear Gaussian distribution with the set number of dimensions and the number of continuous parent dimensions

setParentEvidence

public ConditionalDistribution setParentEvidence(int[] which,
                                                 cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix1D parentValues)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
Reduces this distribution in respect to evidence parents.

Specified by:
setParentEvidence in interface ConditionalDistribution
Specified by:
setParentEvidence in class AbstractConditionalDistribution
Parameters:
which - The indices of the parents we are setting evidence on, this needs to be ascending and unique
parentValues - The values of each corresponding index
Returns:
the distribution with the evidence parents conditioned on, if all parents have been conditioned on this returns a Gaussian, otherwise a LinearGaussian
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalDistribution
Marginalizes out one dimension. If index is < numDiscreteDimensions, it marginalizes out that discrete dimension at index, otherwise it marginalizes out numContinuousDimensions - index dimension in the continuous domain.

Returns:

extend

public int extend(int numStates)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalDistribution
This extends the distribution by 1 dimension. If numStates <= 0, then it extends it in a continuous direction, otherwise it extends it in the discrete domain by adding a dimension with numStates states

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem extending the distribution
